family: Fabaceae (legume family, also known as Leguminosae)
desc: Alfalfa is a perennial crop with an extensive root system. It is primarily cultivated for livestock feed and as a soil conditioner. The plant is highly nutritious and a natural source of nitrogen.
producer_states: Tamil Nadu, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Rajasthan, Punjab, Jammu & Kashmir

common_names: Thotakura, Mulai Keerai, Cheera, Harive, Rajgeera, Rajagaro, Chauli, Rajgira, Ramdana, Chuka, Bathua
scientific_name: Amaranthus spp. (Amaranthus refers to the genus, spp. indicates multiple species)
species: Amaranthus cruentus (Red amaranth, Blood amaranth), Amaranthus hypochondriacus (White amaranth, Prince's feather), Amaranthus caudatus (Love-lies-bleeding)
desc: Amaranth leaves or greens are healthy leafy vegetables rich in protein, minerals, and vitamins A and C. They are widely consumed all over India.
producer_states: Maharashtra, Karnataka, Gujarat

common_names: Tinda, Indian Round Gourd, Indian Baby Pumpkin
genus: Praecitrullus (Monotypic genus, meaning it contains only one species)
desc: A climbing vine with lobed leaves and small, round green fruits with a mild flavor. Grown for its edible immature fruits.
producer_states: Maharashtra, Karnataka, Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu

desc: A perennial herb with broad leaves and underground rhizomes containing a starchy substance used for food and industrial purposes.
producer_states: Kerala, Odisha, West Bengal, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar

division: (No division is typically used in modern plant classification)
desc: Artichoke is a perennial plant cultivated for its immature flower heads, which are the edible part. The globular bud has fleshy scales and a heart-shaped core.
producer_states: Himachal Pradesh, Jammu & Kashmir, Nilgiri Hills

desc: Barley is a hardy cereal crop known for its tolerance to drought and marginal soils. It has a short, stout stature with long, slender leaves and produces grains arranged in a spike.
producer_states: Punjab, Haryana, Jammu & Kashmir, Uttar Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Rajasthan, Bihar, West Bengal

species: Beta vulgaris L. (L. denotes Carl Linnaeus, who named the species)
desc: Beetroot is a root vegetable with a taproot that develops a deep red color. It is a cool-season crop with green leaves and a mildly sweet flavor.
producer_states: Punjab, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, Jammu & Kashmir, Karnataka, Maharashtra

desc: Bitter gourd is a climbing vine with deeply lobed leaves and warty green fruits. It is known for its intensely bitter flavor and potential health benefits.
producer_states: Maharashtra, Gujarat, Rajasthan, Punjab, Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, West Bengal, Odisha, Assam, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar

common_names: Urd, Urd Bean, Urad Bean, Black Lentil, Black Matpe Bean, Mungo Bean, Sabut Urad, Urd, Urad, Urad Dal, Whole Black Gram
desc: Black gram is a short-duration legume known for its black-colored seeds enclosed in small pods. It is a valuable source of protein and dietary fiber.
producer_states: Andhra Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra, Karnataka, Telangana, Gujarat

common_names: Chawli, Raungi, Lobhia, Lobhiya, Chavli, Cow Peas, Barbati, Lobia, Alsande Kalu
desc: Black-eyed pea is a warm-season legume known for its black eye (hilum) and creamy white to black colored beans. The pods can also be eaten immature.
producer_states: Maharashtra, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Telangana, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, West Bengal

desc: Bottle gourd is a climbing vine that produces large, elongated fruits with a hard shell. The immature fruit is eaten as a vegetable, while the mature shell can be dried for various uses.
producer_states: Uttar Pradesh, Haryana, Bihar, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh

desc: Broccoli is a cool-season vegetable with a large, green flowerhead. It is a member of the cabbage family and is a good source of vitamins and minerals.
producer_states: Karnataka, Maharashtra, Himachal Pradesh, Jammu & Kashmir, Uttar Pradesh

desc: Cabbage is a leafy green or purple vegetable with a compact, round head of leaves. It is a cool-season crop known for its crunchy texture and mild, slightly sweet flavor.
producer_states: Uttar Pradesh, Odisha, Bihar, Assam, West Bengal, Maharashtra, Karnataka

common_names: Shimla Mirch, Bell Pepper, Sweet Pepper
desc: Capsicum is a flowering plant producing hollow, pod-shaped fruits in various colors (green, yellow, red, orange) and spice levels. It is a warm-season crop but can be grown in cooler climates with protection.
producer_states: Karnataka, Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Gujarat, Punjab, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh

desc: Carrot is a root vegetable with a long, tapering taproot that develops an orange color. It is a cool-season crop with feathery green leaves and a sweet flavor.
producer_states: Haryana, Punjab, Uttar Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Himachal Pradesh

desc: Cauliflower is a cool-season vegetable with a large, white, edible head (curd) formed by a cluster of flower buds.
producer_states: Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Orissa, Assam, Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat, Haryana

desc: Celery is a herbaceous biennial crop grown for its edible stalks. It has a strong, celery-like flavor and feathery green leaves. In India, it's primarily cultivated for seeds, not the stalks.
producer_states: Punjab, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh

common_names: Garbanzo Beans, Safad Chana, Chana, Kabuli Chana, Chole, Chana Dal, White Chana, Bengal Gram, Kala Chana, Black Chana, Brown Chickpea, Hara Chana, Green Chickpea
desc: Chickpea is a cool-season legume known for its high protein content and drought tolerance. It produces small, round, beige-colored seeds in a pod.
producer_states: Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Bihar

season: Kharif, Rabi, Summer, Rainy, Winter, Zaid
desc: Chilli is a flowering plant producing pungent fruits (pods) in various shapes, sizes, and colors. The pungency comes from capsaicin, a compound concentrated in the membrane around the seeds.
producer_states: Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Maharashtra, Odisha, Tamil Nadu, Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan

desc: Clover is a leguminous forage crop known for its nitrogen-fixing properties and ability to improve soil fertility. Different species have varying growth habits (upright or creeping) and flowering times.
producer_states: Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Bihar

desc: Cluster bean, also known as Guar, is a versatile, drought-tolerant legume widely cultivated in India. Prized for its guar gum extracted from the seeds, a key industrial thickening agent, cluster bean also boasts tender pods consumed as a delicious vegetable. Additionally, it provides valuable fodder for livestock and enriches soil fertility through nitrogen fixation.
producer_states: Rajasthan, Gujarat, Haryana, Punjab, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh

desc: Coriander is an annual herb cultivated for its aromatic leaves and seeds (used as a spice). It has a slender branching stem with finely divided green leaves and white flowers that produce small, round fruits (seeds).
producer_states: Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Uttar Pradesh, Orissa

species: Gossypium arboreum L., Gossypium herbaceum L.
desc: Cotton is a flowering crop known for its fluffy fibers used in textile production. There are four main cultivated species in India, each with slightly different characteristics.
producer_states: Gujarat, Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan
preferred_soil: Alluvial Soil (Sandy Loam), Black Soil, Red Soil

desc: Cucumber is a warm-season vining crop known for its long, cylindrical green fruits. It is a popular salad vegetable and can be eaten fresh or pickled.
producer_states: Karnataka, Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Gujarat, Tamil Nadu, Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana, Bihar, West Bengal

desc: Cumin is a short-season, herbaceous crop valued for its aromatic seeds used as a spice. It has thin, feathery foliage and small white flowers.
producer_states: Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Gujarat

desc: Eggplant is a warm-season vegetable crop known for its large, egg-shaped fruits. The fruits come in various sizes and colors (purple, white, green) and are eaten cooked in many culinary dishes.
producer_states: West Bengal, Orissa, Karnataka, Bihar, Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh, Andhra Pradesh

desc: Fennel is a flowering plant with feathery leaves and a bulbous base. It's cultivated for its aromatic seeds used as a spice and for various medicinal purposes.
producer_states: Gujarat, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal, Andhra Pradesh, Punjab, Karnataka, Haryana

desc: Fenugreek is an annual herb cultivated for its fragrant seeds used as a spice and its leaves used as a fresh or dried vegetable. It also has medicinal properties.
producer_states: Rajasthan, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Tamil Nadu, Punjab

common_names: Val, Val Dal, Broad Beans, Fava Beans, Faba Beans, Hyacinth Bean, Lablab, Lablab bean, Indian bean, Seim bean, Karamani, Mochai, Valacheval
desc: Field bean is a drought-tolerant, nitrogen-fixing legume known for its edible seeds and immature pods. It's a versatile crop with multiple uses for food, fodder, and green manure.
producer_states: Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra

desc: Finger Millet is a highly nutritious cereal known for its calcium content. It thrives in rainfed conditions and can tolerate poor soil fertility.
producer_states: Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Maharashtra, Odisha, Chhattisgarh, Uttarakhand, Himachal Pradesh

desc: Flax is a cool-season crop primarily grown for its seeds (linseed) and fiber. Linseed is a valuable source of omega-3 fatty acids and industrial oil. Flax fiber is used to produce linen fabric known for its strength, durability, and breathability.
producer_states: Chhattisgarh, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Odisha, West Bengal
preferred_soil: Alluvial Soil (Sandy Loam), Silty Loam, Clay Loam, Silty Clay

common_names: French Bean, Snapbean, Green Bean, Bean
desc: French bean is a short-duration, warm-season vegetable crop known for its tender, green pods. It comes in bush (dwarf) and pole varieties.
producer_states: Karnataka, Maharashtra, Gujarat, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, West Bengal

desc: Garlic is a bulb crop widely used as a spice and condiment in Indian cuisine. It has medicinal properties and is valued for its flavor and health benefits.
producer_states: Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat, Rajasthan, Orissa, Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra, Punjab, Haryana

desc: Ginger is a herbaceous perennial crop with a knobby underground rhizome, the edible part. It's a widely used spice with a pungent flavor and aroma.
producer_states: Karnataka, Orissa, Assam, Meghalaya, Arunachal Pradesh, Gujarat

common_names: Yellow Lentils, Mung Beans, Hare Mung, Mung Dal, Moong Dal, Moong
season: Kharif, Rabi, Summer, Rainy, Winter, Zaid
desc: Green gram, also known as mung bean, is a short-duration legume crop valued for its high protein content. It is a versatile food source consumed whole, sprouted, or used in dals (lentils).
producer_states: Maharashtra, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Bihar, Rajasthan, Tamil Nadu

desc: Peanut, also known as groundnut, is a versatile legume crop widely grown in India for its valuable seeds. These seeds are a rich source of protein, healthy fats, vitamins, and minerals, making them a popular dietary component. Additionally, peanut oil, extracted from the seeds, finds applications in cooking and various industrial processes. Beyond its economic value, peanut contributes to soil health by fixing nitrogen through its root system.
producer_states: Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Maharashtra, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Odisha, Telangana

desc: Horse Gram is a drought-resistant legume native to India. It's a versatile crop used for food (dal and rasam), animal fodder, and green manure.
producer_states: Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Odisha, Tamil Nadu, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Bihar, West Bengal, Jharkhand, Uttarakhand, Himachal Pradesh

desc: Ivy Gourd is a vigorously growing vine in the gourd family, cultivated for its immature fruits used as a vegetable. It's known for its tolerance to heat and humidity.
producer_states: Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Gujarat, Odisha, West Bengal, Bihar

desc: Jowar is a versatile and drought-resistant cereal crop belonging to the grass family. It's cultivated for its nutritious grains used for food (bread, roti) and animal feed, and stalks used for fodder and biofuel.
producer_states: Maharashtra, Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Rajasthan, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh, Haryana
preferred_soil: Red Soil, Black Soil, Laterite Soil

scientific_name: Corchorus capsularis (White Jute) & Corchorus olitorius (Tossa Jute)
desc: Jute is a long, bast fiber crop native to India, second only to cotton in terms of global production. It's known for its golden-colored fibers used to make burlap, sacking, and twine. Jute is a high-water requiring crop and thrives in warm, humid conditions.
producer_states: West Bengal, Bihar, Andhra Pradesh, Odisha, Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura

desc: Kale is a leafy green vegetable gaining popularity in India. It's a member of the cabbage family known for its rich nutrient content and cold tolerance.
producer_states: Himachal Pradesh, Jammu & Kashmir

desc: Kidney Beans are a popular legume crop cultivated for their edible dry seeds. They are a good source of protein, fiber, and minerals. Kidney beans come in various colors, including red, black, and white.
producer_states: Maharashtra, Jammu and Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, West Bengal, Uttar Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Karnataka

desc: Kohlrabi is a cool-season vegetable grown for its bulb-like stem called a knob. It has a mild, turnip-like flavor and can be eaten raw, cooked, or pickled.
producer_states: Kashmir, West Bengal, Karnataka

desc: Lady Finger (Bhindi) is a warm-season flowering vegetable crop known for its long, slender green pods. It's a valuable source of vitamins, minerals, and dietary fiber.
producer_states: Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, West Bengal, Orissa, Andhra Pradesh, Maharashtra, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Gujarat, Haryana

desc: Leek is a non-bulb forming member of the onion family, cultivated for its blanched stem and leaves. It has a milder flavor compared to onion and is used in soups, stews, and as a flavoring agent. While not commercially cultivated in India, it can be grown in home gardens.
producer_states: Maharashtra, Himachal Pradesh

desc: Lettuce is a cool-season leafy green vegetable with a crisp texture and mild flavor. It's commonly used in salads and sandwiches.
producer_states: Himachal Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana, Jammu & Kashmir, Karnataka, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu

desc: Luffa is a fast-growing vine cultivated for its fibrous mature fruits used as natural sponges. It requires a warm climate and support for vertical growth.
producer_states: Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra, Gujarat, Odisha, West Bengal, Bihar

desc: Lupinus albus, commonly known as Lupin Bean, is a winter legume cultivated for its protein-rich seeds used as food and animal feed. It can improve soil fertility through nitrogen fixation.
producer_states: Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu

desc: Maize, also known as Corn, is a cereal grain crop cultivated for its starchy kernels. It's a versatile crop used for food (cornmeal, flour), animal feed, and industrial products.
producer_states: Madhya Pradesh, Karnataka, Rajasthan, Andhra Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Maharashtra, Telangana, Gujarat, Tamil Nadu

desc: Mint is aromatic herb cultivated for its fragrant leaves used in culinary applications, beverages, and medicinal purposes. There are two main cultivated varieties in India - Spearmint (Mentha arvensis) and Peppermint (Mentha piperita).
producer_states: Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana, Bihar, Madhya Pradesh, Uttarakhand
sowing_method: Vegetative propagation through stem cuttings or stolons (runners)

desc: Moth Bean is a drought-resistant legume native to India. It's a versatile crop cultivated for its edible green pods (vegetable), mature dry beans (dal), animal fodder, and green manure.
producer_states: Rajasthan, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Haryana, Maharashtra, Karnataka

desc: Muskmelon is a warm-season vine grown for its sweet, juicy fruit. It's a popular summer fruit in India. While traditionally a summer crop, advancements in cultivation techniques allow for winter cultivation in some regions.
producer_states: Punjab, Tamil Nadu, Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Madhya Pradesh

desc: Mustard is a cool-season oilseed crop cultivated in India for its tiny seeds that produce pungent edible oil. The young leaves of the mustard plant are also used as a leafy green vegetable. There are several types of mustard cultivated in India, but Indian mustard (Brassica Juncea) is the most common.
producer_states: Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, Haryana, Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu

desc: Oats is a cereal crop known for its nutritious value. It is a cool-season grass that thrives in moderate temperatures and prefers well-drained soils. Oats can be grown for its grain, used in oatmeal and other food products, or as a forage crop for livestock.
producer_states: Punjab, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Jammu & Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh, Bihar, Odisha

desc: Onion is a bulb vegetable cultivated for its pungent flavor and fleshy bulb. It's a cool-season crop with a shallow root system. India is the world's second-largest producer of onions and has unique varieties known for their strong flavor.
producer_states: Maharashtra, Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat, Rajasthan, Bihar, Andhra Pradesh

desc: Pearl Millet is a drought-tolerant cereal known for its tolerance to poor soil conditions. It's a staple food in many parts of India.
producer_states: Rajasthan, Maharashtra, Karnataka, Gujarat, Haryana, Andhra Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Tamil Nadu

common_names: Mutter, Matar, Mattar, Hara Matar, Matar Dal
desc: Pea is a cool-season legume vegetable crop cultivated for its green immature pods containing edible peas. They are a good source of protein, fiber, vitamins, and minerals. Peas are used in various dishes, both fresh and frozen.
producer_states: Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Bihar, Maharashtra, Haryana, Rajasthan, Punjab, Karnataka

common_names: Toor, Toor Dal, Tur, Arhar, Arhar Dal, Tuvar, Yellow Split Peas
desc: Pigeon pea is a legume that is drought-tolerant and nitrogen-fixing. It is a good source of protein and is an important crop in India. Pigeon peas are used in dals (lentils), curries, and other dishes.
producer_states: Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Gujarat

desc: Pointed gourd is a climbing vine that produces long, slender fruits. It is a popular vegetable in India and is used in curries, stir-fries, and other dishes. Pointed gourd is a good source of vitamins and minerals.
producer_states: West Bengal, Maharashtra, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh

desc: Potato is a herbaceous perennial that is grown for its starchy tubers. It is a major food source worldwide and is a versatile ingredient in many dishes. Potatoes are a good source of vitamins, minerals, and fiber.
producer_states: Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, West Bengal, Bihar, Punjab

desc: Pumpkin is a flowering vine in the Cucurbitaceae family. It is a warm-season crop that is native to America. Pumpkins are grown for their large, round fruits, which can be eaten fresh, cooked, or canned. They are a good source of vitamins A and C, and fiber.
producer_states: Karnataka, Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana

desc: Radish is a root vegetable that is grown for its taproot, which can be eaten raw, cooked, or pickled. Radishes are a good source of vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants.
producer_states: Punjab, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, West Bengal

scientific_name: Brassica oleracea var. capitata f. rubra L.
desc: Red cabbage is a variety of cabbage that is known for its deep purple or red color. It is a cool-season crop that is related to broccoli, cauliflower, and kale. Red cabbage is a good source of vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants.
producer_states: Maharashtra, Karnataka, Himachal Pradesh, Jammu & Kashmir

desc: Red Kuri squash is a winter squash variety known for its elongated neck and bright orange-red rind. It has a sweet, nutty flavor and is a good source of vitamins A and C, and fiber.
producer_states: Karnataka, Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu

common_names: Brown Lentils, Orange Lentils, Pink Lentils, Sabut Masoor, Masoor Dal
desc: Red lentil is a legume that is high in protein and fiber. It cooks quickly and has a slightly peppery flavor. Red lentils are a popular ingredient in Indian dals (soups) and curries.
producer_states: Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Karnataka, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar

desc: Rice is a grass species that is a staple food for over half of the world's population. It is a good source of carbohydrates, vitamins, and minerals. There are many different varieties of rice, each with its own unique flavor and texture.
producer_states: West Bengal, Andhra Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Telangana, Punjab, Haryana, Odisha

desc: Ridge gourd is a climbing vine that produces long, ribbed fruits. It is a popular vegetable in India and is used in curries, stir-fries, and other dishes. Ridge gourd is a good source of vitamins, minerals, and fiber.
producer_states: Karnataka, Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Gujarat

scientific_name: Brassica oleracea var. botrytis L. cv. Romanesco
desc: Romanesco cauliflower, also known as Romanesco broccoli, is a unique vegetable with a lime green, fractal-shaped head resembling a pinecone. It has a delicate, nutty flavor similar to cauliflower and broccoli. Romanesco is a cool-season crop that thrives in moderate temperatures.
producer_states: Karnataka, Maharashtra

desc: Rye is a cereal grain that is closely related to barley and wheat. It is a good source of carbohydrates, protein, and fiber. Rye is often used to make bread, but it can also be used in other products such as cereals, flour, and whiskey. Rye is more tolerant of cold and poor soil conditions than wheat.
producer_states: Jammu & Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand

desc: Snake gourd is a climbing vine that produces long, slender fruits. It is a popular vegetable in India and is used in curries, stir-fries, and other dishes. Snake gourd is a good source of vitamins, minerals, and fiber. The immature fruits are preferred for consumption as the mature ones become fibrous.
producer_states: West Bengal, Maharashtra, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu

desc: Soybean is a legume that is a major source of protein and oil. It is used in a variety of food products, such as tofu, tempeh, and soy milk. Soybeans are also an important source of animal feed.
producer_states: Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Rajasthan, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh

desc: Spinach is a leafy green vegetable that is a good source of vitamins A, C, and K. It is also a good source of iron and folate. Spinach can be eaten raw, cooked, or juiced.
producer_states: Punjab, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Jammu & Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh

desc: Sugarcane is a tall grass that is the primary source of sugar worldwide. Sugar is extracted from the juice of the sugarcane stalks. Sugarcane is a C4 plant, meaning it is very efficient at photosynthesis in hot and sunny climates.
producer_states: Maharashtra, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Uttar Pradesh, Andhra Pradesh

desc: Sweet potato is a starchy root vegetable that is a good source of vitamins A, C, and fiber. It has a naturally sweet flavor and can be eaten roasted, baked, mashed, or fried.
producer_states: Maharashtra, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Bihar, Odisha

common_names: Swiss Chard, Patte Saag, Bok Choi
desc: Swiss chard is a leafy green vegetable that is related to beet greens. It has a mild, slightly sweet flavor and is a good source of vitamins A, C, and K. Swiss chard can be eaten raw, cooked, or juiced.
producer_states: Punjab, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Jammu & Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh

desc: Taro is a root vegetable with a starchy, potato-like flavor. It is a staple food in many Pacific Island cultures and is also gaining popularity in other parts of the world. Taro can be boiled, baked, roasted, or fried. The leaves can also be eaten as a green vegetable.
producer_states: Odisha, West Bengal, Kerala, Assam, Andhra Pradesh
sowing_method: Corms or suckers from mature plants

desc: The tomato is a versatile fruit (often referred to as a vegetable) native to South America. It is a bushy or vining plant with red, yellow, or orange fruits. Tomatoes are a staple ingredient in many Indian dishes and are enjoyed fresh, cooked in curries, or juiced.
producer_states: Maharashtra, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu

desc: Turmeric is a root spice native to India and Southeast Asia. It is the bright yellow spice that gives curry powder its color. Turmeric is also used in traditional Indian medicine for its anti-inflammatory properties.
producer_states: Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Odisha
sowing_method: Corms or suckers from mature plants

desc: The turnip is a root vegetable with a bulbous, white or purple colored flesh. It has a mild, slightly sweet flavor and can be eaten raw, cooked, or pickled. Turnips are a good source of vitamins C and K.
producer_states: Punjab, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh

desc: Watercress is a leafy green aquatic plant with a peppery flavor. It is a good source of vitamins A, C, and K. Watercress is typically eaten fresh in salads or sandwiches.
producer_states: Jammu & Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand

desc: Wax gourd is a climbing vine that produces long, slender fruits with a waxy coating. The immature fruits are preferred for consumption as they have a milder flavor and softer texture. Wax gourd is a good source of vitamins and fiber.
producer_states: West Bengal, Maharashtra, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu

desc: Wheat is a cereal crop that is grown for its edible grains. Wheat is a major source of carbohydrates and protein in India and is used to make flour for bread, chapatti, and other food products.
producer_states: Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan

desc: Yams are a starchy root vegetable with a rough, brown skin and white, yellow, or purple flesh. They have a slightly sweet, nutty flavor and can be boiled, roasted, or mashed. Yams are a good source of vitamins A, C, and potassium.
producer_states: Odisha, Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh, Kerala

desc: Yardlong beans are a long, slender variety of bean with green pods that can reach up to a meter (3 feet) in length. They have a crisp texture and a slightly sweet flavor. Yardlong beans are typically stir-fried or used in curries.
producer_states: Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra

desc: Zucchini is a summer squash that is a variety of cucumber. It is a cylindrical fruit with green or yellow skin and white flesh. Zucchini has a mild, slightly sweet flavor and can be eaten raw, cooked, or grilled.
producer_states: Karnataka, Maharashtra, Himachal Pradesh, Haryana
